content.description: An excellent warmup for the other lines at Eagles. Steep enough to get the blood flowing and thought provoking to get the mind working. A great and fairly sustained route for the grade.
content.location: Starts right by the obvious tree and shares the first bolt with Tree Hugger. Goes straight up the vertical face while Tree Hugger goes left up the arete/dihedral feature. The anchors are a bit left of the rest of the bolt line, although you could potentially climb up to the anchors for the Overstory if you were so inclined.

content.description: A short and sweet route up the far right side of the Overstory Wall. Good variety of moves for the grade. Some loose rock still, but should continue to clean up as it sees more ascents.
content.location: The farthest right line of the entire crag. Shares the first bolt with the Overstory, then heads straight up.

content.description: Follows the low-angle arete/dihedral feature by the tree up to a ledge before finishing up a short headwall. Shares the start with Webs of Connection and the finish to the Descent, but it seems to link the worst parts of both routes. While it's not the most exciting route on its own, it does provide TR access for the Descent.
content.location: Shares the first bolt with Webs of Connection before heading left and up the arete/dihedral feature to easier ground. Finishes at the same anchors as the Descent.

content.description: A fun route and a good warmup. Starts with a vertical section before finishing with an easy romp up low-angle terrain.
content.location: Shares the first bolt with the Understory (although I highly recommend skipping this bolt, it will significantly reduce rope drag) before heading left and up an arete feature. It's best climbed on the steep face left of the arete, but some will choose to stay more above the arete.

content.description: Low crux just after the first bolt. Permadraw in place. Great sequence through this leads to a fun bulge before an easy slab up top.
content.protection: Bolts. Steel carabiners on anchor. Lower off.

content.description: This area is the classic beginners/warmup section. If you take the furthest right trail from the road it should spit you out right bear the base of this wall. Generally one of the furthest right walls overall.
